bioghist.p: The Aero Service Corporation began in 1919 in Philadelphia and was a pioneer and world leader in aerial photography and photogrammetry. Directed by Virgil I. Kauffman, a World War I veteran pilot who joined the company in 1924, the firm obtained lucrative government and private contracts including those with the United States Geological Survey and the Tennessee Valley Authority that involved some of the first aerial surveys of the country. In 1924, pilot J. Victor Dallin, a former member of the Royal Air Force and veteran of the First World War, formed the Dallin Aerial Survey Company. Operating out of the Philadelphia Municipal Airport, his company was one of many during the era searching for business opportunities that utilized the nascent technology of the airplane. Dallin's company took thousands of aerial photographs throughout the Mid-Atlantic region, most in the Philadelphia area. The Delaware Valley Regional Planning Commission (DVRPC) is the metropolitan planning organization for the Delaware Valley. Created in 1965 by an interstate compact, DVRPC is responsible for transportation and regional planning in the greater Philadelphia area.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of aerial photographs of Philadelphia and vicinity from 1928 to 2000. Materials in the collection include: 170 aerial photographs of Philadelphia and the surrounding area by the Regional Planning Federation of the Philadelphia Tri-State District, 1928; 33 aerial photographs, as well as 4 boxes of reformatted photographs, of Philadelphia and the surrounding area by Dallin Aerial Surveys, 1930; 5 volumes, reformatted into 23 boxes of aerial photographs of Philadelphia and the vicinity by Aero Service Corporation, 1945; 6 boxes of Philadelphia aerial photographs, which was reflown by the Aero Service Corporation, 1950; aerial photographs of Philadelphia and vicinity by Delaware Valley Regional Planning Commission, with sets for Philadelphia from every 5 years, and more sporadic coverage of the surrounding area, 1965-1995; and aerial photographs in digital form of the Delaware Valley region by Delaware Valley Regional Planning Commission, 2000. (Note that all available DVRPC photos from 1965-2005 will soon be available in digital format.) The collection also includes real estate atlases by Real Estate Data Inc. for Bucks, Montgomery (2 volumes), Chester, and Delaware counties, 1971-1979.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
